Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to get robbed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ikbal M
Reviews.Content: Right, I was just like you reading the reviews on this very site and I thought as I am travelling with 15 lads we simply need a bed to crash in. This hotel is absolutely rubbish and please please listen to my advice DO NOT go there if you are a couple because you will get robbed which I witnessed from my hotel window. The pick pocketers are immigrants of Arab or black race so stay clear. The couple were entering our hotel entrance where two young boys suddenly wanted to show him a trick which was a bit like a three legged race, I could not believe my eyes how fast the thief took the mans I-phone from the FRONT JEANS pocket! How?!! But he did and the other thief walked by casually and walked away with an Iphone. The hotel is situated in the heart of Red Light District which means you will get working girls 24 hours round the clock – they do shift work. The Hotel staffs are the most miserable people I have ever met in my life; there is a guy at reception with glasses who does the graveyard shift who made me want to poke his eyes out.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills City Stop”
Reviews.Author: WillMcLaverty
Reviews.Content: From the outset it is worth saying that I stayed at the Hotel Barbara whilst taking a weekend out in Barcelona with a friend of mine. With this in mind, what I was looking for was a cheap hotel and something that places me as close in the colour of life in central Barcelona as possible. With Hotel Barbara this is just what you get. Rooms wise the hotel is extremely basic, I am unsure if they have any food options as we didn't even attempt to ask. This is a hotel for someone who essentially would like somewhere near the centre of town to crash when not out exploring the beautiful and vivid city. The hotel is situated right near La Rambla, and as other reviews have stated, being so close does mean that the area is frequented by prostitutes and is quite lively outside its doors. I myself cannot complain about this noise filtering through into my room at night and therefore cannot verify some of the other reviews that might have been written by people on a different side of the hotel from myself. Yes there are prostitutes outside who can be more than a little persistent. I found the best way to deal with this is to take it as philosophically as possible, and without condoning it, greet it as another part of the Barcelona experience. If you are on the kind of trip where you want to hit the allies of a great European city, eat breakfast somewhere a little different every morning, grab a can of Estrella and sit on some steps and take in the life of Barcelona then this hotel will give you the basis to do that from. If however you prefer somewhere a little more comfortable than a bedroom in town to leave your stuff in and grab some rest in, then Hotel Barbara may not be for yourself. It is not a luxury hotel destination and it is not suited for the whole family after certain hours. However, it is a hotel that allows people in the city who wanna see the sights, rent a bike and ride around for a day and catch some dinner on La Rambla with very little time spent in the hotel to do just that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy and prostitutes area”
Reviews.Author: Nia01
Reviews.Content: Hotel is falling apart we got en suite room with broken window. Don't go to this hotel on falls, winter or early spring. Chilly at nite if you can not lock your window properly. It's prostitutes area. It's not cheap if you see the hotel condition but best location you can find easily foods around the hotel. Walking distance to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as others say”
Reviews.Author: the_bobster1981
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night it cost 125€ for a triple room with 3single beds it was exactly what we wanted, we got a room at the front of the building. I dont deny the other reviews, yes there were prostitues by night but around the corner not outside the hotel as others have said. By night it was quite noisy from a near by bar and the rubbish bins were collected at some ungodly hour in the early morning. but all in all it served its purpose, cheap hotel few mins from las ramblas, very very clean, and the 2 staff we met were very very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: Sazling
Reviews.Content: Never been treated so badly by anybody claiming to be in the hospitality industry. Horrifying. Ruined my trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: CuleBlue
Reviews.Content: Arrived at midday to see a line of prostitutes and, presumably, their pimps outside. Inside, the bed was so unpleasant I chose to sleep on top of it and thd shower so filthy looking that I wouldn't contemplate using it despite being a sweltering early summer day.

Reviews.Title: “It is definitely not a value for money”
Reviews.Author: Upasana87
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights and it was definitely not a value for money. It was 100 Euros per night for a twin bedroom and the room was very basic. It was clean of course but the hotel is too old and hence the room was damp and dingy with no supply of fresh air. It was a very small room for the price we paid and I would prefer a hostel like Be Sound than this hotel! The area is strictly just all right, in a lane close to La Ramblas. The worst was the day time receptionist. She was quite rude, absolutely rigid, always on the phone and simply refused to cater to customer grievances. I definitely do not expect that kind of a service at the price I pay! Even internet is not free. we had to buy access for 12 Euros which I consider an absolute rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Budget/No Thrills Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: intheheights63
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barbara is situated pretty much in the centre of Barcelona & cost €30 per room, per night. Of course if you are expecting the Ritz then this is not the place for you. If you want somewhere cheap, central but still secure, this is the place. Other reviews are correct, there were a few prostitutes outside the hotel but they're not throwing themselves at you and we felt safe enough walking by. The rooms were fairly sparse but had the essentials- which lets face it is all you really need! The bathroom is big and had both shower and tub. The only real problem we had was the lack of electrical sockets- we were able to find one in the bathroom & one really high up on the bedroom wall (too high to reach!). As we had been traveling around Spain we had many things to charge, ipods, laptops, phones, and of course we needed to dry & straighten hair etc but one socket was still manageable! Staff were polite, check-in was quick and internet was also available on a computer in reception for a very reasonable price. I'd stay here again if i was visiting Barcelona on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sirdavidofbrent
Reviews.Content: Yes there are prostitutes outside and the hotel is very basic, but it's cheap and it serves a purpose. Right near Las Ramblas and many metro stations. The customer service was great, the receptionists helped us with locations of certain things in the city and the best ways to get there. If you are young, like myself, and just in Barcelona with friends then this hotel would be a good fit for you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst places we have stayed”
Reviews.Author: foodiesarah
Reviews.Content: FIrstly we arrived a good two hours after check-in had started, only to wait 30 minutes in a line, then to find that the double rooms we not ready and we could have a twin if we wanted. We said we would wait and came back at 8PM only to be put in a twin anyway. We asked to be moved and the lady in reception slammed the key down on the counter. The bed was terrible, the noise from outside is so loud, there are prostitutes lined up at the front of the hotel and you have to pay for the remote control for the TV in your room. The safe in the room had no key and the lady in reception told us not t to worry and just hide our passports under the bed. The internet was down for the 4 days we were there and we were told it was due to an electrical problem. Don't bother, stay further out to save money and travel in.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mceaves
Reviews.Content: We did not even get out of the cab as there drug dealers and prostitutes on the corner. Our cab advised us that is was not safe. Hotel looks close to center of Barcelona but is in a horrible place..

Reviews.Title: “What you expect for the price.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferMelbourne_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a VERY long flight and were extremely tired so were happy the girl behind the reception was polite and had a smile for us. We were a bit put off at first by the ladies of the night just outside when we arrived but the building was secure so no problem with people wandering in to the hotel. The room was small and basic but clean, we booked a double and were given a twin which they fixed straight away. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas. I would not want to be a single female walking back to the hotel after dark as there are always men hanging around the prostitutes but as I was with my husband it sort of added to the colour!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - ROOMS WITHOUT WINDOWS”
Reviews.Author: Nevenatas
Reviews.Content: Yes, indeed, it is quite a cheap hotel with good location, if you do not consider the fact that prostitutes are biding their time around. We were offered "the last" room available in the hotel but the girl at the reception refused to let us look at it as she was alone on shift and afterwards to our great surprise it turned out that our room did not have a single window. Luckily, the walls are so thin that we could know if outside it is raining so that we can go out properly dressed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: bad experience”
Reviews.Author: mmottonen
Reviews.Content: I booked a room from this hotel via venere.com. Confirmation was sent and unlike normally with venere.com, the price was charged from my credit card (first night). That was, however, stated in the confirmation. When arriving the hotel a month later, they did not have a room for us. due to "late arrival of the reservation". We were in place at 1400h. They suggested accommondation in their sister hotel, close to Park Guell - reasonable distance, but not Ramblas, 3stars at the same price. We took it - later I foound out that the sister hotel is actually normally a cheaper alternative. Even worse, they claimed that room was not paid with "100 per cent" certainty and new payment was needed. That was not the case - now VISA has returned the payment on my request. I made naturally a reclamaton to venere.com. That was complicated. Several emails, international calls and even fax. They needed invoices ect and did not read their own confirmation that "first night will be charged". In their reply they just replyed the hotel's message. No explanation why no room, no apoligese, compenstion and even they were wrong, So, not recommend this hotel in the **** area and not recommend venere.com. Who to blame? Both I think.

Reviews.Title: “beware!!! 2 day reservation cancelation policy!!! they charge your card if you cancel”
Reviews.Author: bradsholto
Reviews.Content: Dont book a room at this hotel unless your sure you want it they will charge your card and keep your money unless you cancel within 48 hours

Reviews.Title: “Cheap tacky hotel with no service - spoiled my Barcelona trip!”
Reviews.Author: Pi0neer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barbara has very limited services, and is not even up to standards of a Youth Hostel. Located in the back end of small bystreet street, it is not safely situated opposite to a small tacky pub - thief and prostitutes around. My camera was stolen by thief here in a matter of 30 seconds! Truely worst accommodation I ever stayed while travelling 10 different countries around the world. Very basic small room, TV not working, disappeared my personal stuff by housekeeper, poor heating, no duvet but thin blanket - I finally got cold and no hot water for my medicine! Reported to hotel but answered "nothing we can do". In summer there will be very hot with no air conditioning as it seems to have air circulation system only. Hotel was very money oriented, staff were unhelpful and rude. From the point of check in till departure, there was something to make us unpleasant from this hotel every day. We couldn't enjoy the most in Barcelona due to this poor accommodation and also no service or personal touch for little things that any hostel or hotel may normally assist with. If you want to make your trip worthy, please select a helpful, comfortable place to stay - rather a friendly youth hostel or other 1-2* hotels on Ramblas main street rather than this end bystreet. I struggled during my Barcelona trip as I couldn't collect valuable travel information which we would normally gather from my overnight accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “best value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Dominikstravel
Reviews.Content: Grat location 400 m from Ramblas. Standard 1 star hotel, old rooms but for 25 Euro it is much more then I expected. Very firndly good english speking reception

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: drmaryk
Reviews.Content: We are accustomed to budget hotels and are experienced travellers, but we have never stayed in such an awful place. Worse than a student hostel. The only thing it has going for it is the location close to La Ramblas. Room was dirty, dated and the beds were terrible. A little window high on the wall opened into a tunnel. Stay away from this hotel. Dr. Mary K.

Reviews.Title: “Bad neighborhood and no nothing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mbeireis
Reviews.Content: Before we could find Hotel Barbara my husband was yelled at by the prostitutes outside the door. We were firghtened to go out and come back at night. Nothing is included in the price. The saving grace is a decent room and close to Las Ramblas. Book with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - I´m not at all picky, but this place was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: chamdo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in January. The price was unbeatable, but that is the ONLY thing this place had going for it. I have travelled extensively throughout Europe and this is the worst hotel I´ve ever stayed in. We got there the first day and were greeted by a woman who coughed and sneezed all over our IDs as she wrote down our information. The room was no more sanitary - hair in the shower and on the floor, along with used tissue. We were woken up every couple of hours throughout the night because the place is on a small square where locals and prostitutes congregate. We asked to switch to an interior room the next night, and the receptionist nodded knowingly and started talking about how horribly loud it always is on weekends! We moved to a much smaller room, slightly cleaner than the last. We would have been able to sleep that night if it hadn´t been for the other guests (the walls are paper-thin, and you hear EVERYTHING). The showers are awful; in both rooms, the showerhead came out of the ceiling and can´t be angled, and there is only a half-door (hard to describe), so water inevitably ends up everywhere. I am a young, cheap traveller, and the only thing I look for in a hotel is a place to sleep. You can´t even do that at this hotel. We arrived back from our short "vacation" exhausted. If the price is too alluring for you to stay away, at least request an interior room!

Reviews.Title: “Really great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Fabulousbear
Reviews.Content: I read the tripadvisor reviews on this place prior to booking, and was a bit worried about it being in the "red light district". However, when we got there, we didn't see a single "lady" around at all. In fact, there were cops around and the receptionist said that the city has been trying to improve the image of the area by driving those people away recently. It felt very safe and I don't think people have to worry about running into prostitutes anymore. We got a really good price for this place on priceline, it was about $100 cheaper per night compared to anything else in the area. We were happy with what we got given what we paid. We are in our mid-20's, and price was a priority for us so I thought that this was "above average" relative to the price. It's clean enough, but there's kind of a bit of an old run down kind of feel to it. It's to be expected though. The receptionist at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. She gave us a fantastic recommendation for dinner where we had the best tapas ever. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: famousfiveWiltshire
Reviews.Content: 5 of us "older" people (Average age 60) stayed here for a 4 day city break. We found the staff welcoming and friendly. The rooms were basic, but very clean and towels were changed every day. The front desk staff were very helpful and gave us plenty of information about where to go and what to see and also how to get about. We never tried the breakfasts, preferring to go out to a street cafe. The hotel, although situated in the red light district is very centrally placed for getting about the city. We were not bothered once by the "ladies" even though we were 3 men and 2 women. The only problem we encountered was by some black ladies in the Ramblas who tried to pick our pockets, successfully with one of us. This was nowhere near the hotel though. All in all we had a great time here and would recommend it to all looking for a cheap weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and close to las ramblas”
Reviews.Author: joycie22
Reviews.Content: On travelling to barcelona for a four day break we wanted to spend our money on seeing the sights, so opted for a cheap accomodation. hotel barbara is certainly that! it is on a side street off las ramblas where the prostitutes hang out. they did not bother us once but it is quite a sad sight to see. we booked a double, however on arrival (late at night) we recieved two singles. we did not get our double room until the following morning, when i asked again. the first room was absolutely tiny as was the loo. I was upset to have booked such a bad spot. but on moving our second room was much bigger, it had a large sink and bath area, and a bathroom off to one side. okay so the bed was creaky and uncomfortable but as a sightseeing base, this hotel was perfect. if you are not picky about luxurys, and just was somewhere to lay ur head at night, then this is fine. we had continental breakfast every morning, which was buns or croissonts and coffee and juice. we got the sightseeing bus for 2 days which was brilliant, and got to see guell park, the cathedral and neu camp, which even i enjoyed, not being a footie fan. barcelona is a great city i would return again.

Reviews.Title: “At least it's entertaining.”
Reviews.Author: Sarahincalifornia
Reviews.Content: If you can afford an extra $10...stay somewhere else. The two redeeming qualities of this hotel are that the staff was very friendly and the rooms are clean. That being said, the hotel is in a very seedy area. There are prostitutes, looking like they stepped off of the set of Pretty Woman, standing all over the place right outside the hotel. We got a kick out of watching the men gawk at them and eventually strike up a deal. The rooms are stuffy, sterile, and there is A LOT of noise from construction and normal plumbing. It's affordable and near La Rambla, but there are hundreds of budget hotels in that area. This isn't your only option for a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly as it says on the tin....”
Reviews.Author: BennoDeal_Kent
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 day stag weekend. All the staff were good as gold & very friendly...clean rooms...fresh towels each day...hot/cold running water...a toilet that works...need we have asked for more?? ok so its a bit seedy outside, but keep yourself to yourself and your wits about you then its fine. One of the boys were pick pocketed on the ramblas, even though some of the characters outside our hotel looked dodgy...they were the ones who left us alone If you want a REAL bit of Barca and your on a budget then get this is ok...wouldn't really stay here with the mrs buts thats only coz she'd flip (i know what side my breads buttered boys)... Hotel Barbara...thanks for the stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qwerty_Rome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barbara Hotel with my boyfriend last december, for five nights, and it was perfect: very cheap and very clean and basic, just what we were looking for! The room was not too small, the bathroom was VERY clean, and the staff was very friendly. It is situated in the red light distric of El Raval, BUT it's a two minutes walk to La Rambla, and no one bothered us on our way. I absolutely recommend this hotel if you're looking for a good clean place to rest after visiting and enjoying Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Red Light District, but Close to La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: SamsOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. Construction started at 8AM and didn't stop until 7PM or so. I don't know what they were doing, but it sounded like MAJOR work. Jackhammer type noice like they were tearing down inner walls downstairs. Everytime a toilet flushed or someone took a shower it sounded like there was a flood of water running inside the walls. There was lots of noise all night long, and we could hear the people in the next room quite clearly, just talking. The room is basically clean and adequate, the staff are friendly, but I wouldn't go back. The hotel is smack dab in the middle of the red light district, although I didn't see any undesireable business going on inside the hotel. Coming home from dinner each night, you had to wade through the hookers and men. I didn't feel unsafe though, as there is steady police patrol through the area. It is only two or three blocks straight to La Ramblas though, so the location to the sites and metro stops was ideal. There was a television set, but no remote control, and the TV was way high up on the wall. You had to get on the bed to turn it on or off. If you can afford to spend a little more, do it.

Reviews.Title: “it was fine”
Reviews.Author: CybeleGR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days in May with my boyfriend. I had read all reviews and expected worse ,to be honest. The area outside the hotel is full of prostitutes and weird men, but noone bothered us and we felt safe everytime we passed through them. Most girls are dressed normally and are not provocative, they just stand there, waiting. The hotel itself is simple, the staff friendly..i had asked for a room that would look on the back and this is what we got. The room was small and very simple, but it was very clean and there was no noise whatsoever coming from outside. Beds were comfortable,the room had airconditioning ,a TV with spanish and a german channel and the closet had a safety box that costed 4euros/day. We thought it was ok to pay 20euros and leave our money there, so that's what we did. The negative was that we could hear the next door flush and shower, and early in the morning there was some noise from the cleaning ladies, but generally it was ok. The location is excellent, very close to the Ramblas and we also bought from the mini markets close to the hotel, owned by indy or pakistans, but nice and cheap (especially water). We were both satisfied with our stay at hotel barbara.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful though don't forget your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Belly1505
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over new year with my boyfriend and 4 other friends. Having read the reviews it was what we expected. We paid £128 each for 4 nights [through easytobook.com]. It is very central - 5 mins walk from La Ramblas. As people say it is not a very nice area, but now l have been l can safely say anywhere round La Ramblas is the same, everyone looks dodgy and every street seedy but it's fine you just need to be aware. When people say it is noisy it isn't outside which is what l thought they meant but INSIDE the hotel. It was quiet around 3am-5am when we got to bed [except for a most annoying clicking outside the window and a couple having a huge screaming match] but the residents were really bloody noisy early in the morning 6am-10am [fine if you're an early bird and don't want a lie in] and as for the cleaners - they sounded like they were having a party, seriously it sounded like there were about 10 of them and they spent what seemed hours outside our door. They are also v keen to clean your room [daily] which is good but not if you want some rest! I had to keep saying no thank you in spanish over and over. I also said no to towels repeatedly to get rid of her - in the end she actualyl left some outside so was all good. Reception were helpful, they sorted a taxi and gave me a double instead of a twin on request. The place was clean. Mattress was actuallly good but we had to put it on the floor and prop the bed against the wall as it was so squeaky! Shower was a laughable dribble but thankfully hot. It's basic but you get what you pay for and if like us you literally want to kip [seriously get ear plugs tho!] and somewhere to wash it's fine. Also if you go in winter remember to put the fan on as it was bloody cold with the thin blanket and sheet. Hookers outside at 10am and either their pimps or dealers milling about all the time but we didn't get any hassle, just don't make eye contact and it's fine. All in all if you want something cheap and central you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Ninjaman0714
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights with a buddy on a small Euro trip, after visiting Amsterdam. I was a bit skeptical walking down the street, and after staying in the 2 star hotel in Amsterdam, I expected this to be pretty much the same type - very cramped, not very clean, fairly out of the way, etc. I must say, I was very pleasantly surprised! The room was not gigantic, but by no means was it cramped. Everything was clean, the bathroom spacious enough, and the staff was fantastic! The location is perfect, about midway up the Ramblas. Just outside the hotel is a hub of prostitution, but no one harasses you, and they just keep to their business, so that's not an issue. I would not recommend to any families, or anyone looking for luxury. But for anyone on a budget, who plans to use the room just for sleep, shower and shelter, wants somewhere clean and strategically located, this is as ideal as they come.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good”
Reviews.Author: elpuerta
Reviews.Content: Me and two other lads stayed here and found it ok. The street it is on is not the best, but the hotel itself is nice. The staff are very friendly and theres someone on the desk 24/7. Room was very basic but had the essentials. Personally we did not hear any noise fro mthe streets. If you want a cheap hotel then this hotel does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest place”
Reviews.Author: travelbug015
Reviews.Content: If you can afford to spend a little more - do it! Hotel Barbara is not the safest place, granted that it is nearby many restaurants and other stores. The noise level is unbareable and it went on all night long, my friends and I were unable to sleep. We were suppose to be there for 3 days but after the first night we decided to check out the next day. Needless to say I won't be staying there any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: PJC_7S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Barbara during 3GSM (a big telecomms trade show). After reading some of the previous reviews I wasn't really sure what to expect, and was a little concerned regarding the level of cleanliness of the rooms. However my room was fine, very basic, a little noisy, small but most importantly clean. The bed was pretty uncomfortable and creeky but didn't prevent me from sleeping (certainly after a couple of beers anyway!) Yes there is a large gathering of people outside of the hotel in the evening but generally they don't bother you, and if they do they are not persistent. The hotel is positioned a 5 min walk from La Ramblas, and close to two metro stations. All in all the Hotel Barbara is a very basic (and more importantly), clean hotel, with friendly staff. Perfect for people on a (very) tight budget. Anyone looking or expecting something different maybe this isn't for you !

Reviews.Title: “not with your girlfiend”
Reviews.Author: charlieparker12
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights. The location is convinient, close to the Rambla, the staff relatively friendly. However, the rooms are tiny and are not comfortable. The wardrobe is extremly small, the beds short and cheap. Small things like a place to leave your toothbrush are missing, the TV very little and on the ceiling, tiles on the floor. It was relatively clean though, if you can live with threadbare towels and mold on the bathroom ceiling. If you are there for a cheap weekend to party with a friend it can be okay if you have no expectations, but do not go there with your girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Shady and Seedy!”
Reviews.Author: Homogenous
Reviews.Content: What can I say!, it costs very little to stay here and the proximity to La Rambla is a plus. On the other hand it was the only negative thing about my trip to Barcelona. The rooms are tiny, creatures crawling on the floor, noisy, unbearably stuffy and hot, shower did not work on the first morning, prostitutes and other dubious characters hanging around outside, dreadful stench on the street outside(did experience some wretching)....worst place I have ever stayed......makes a tent look like luxury. Never again. Barcelona is fantastic, I would definately spend a bit more on accommodation next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews I was worried about staying at this hotel, although I needn't have been. Although this is a one star, the service is great, everything from the greeting you get when you arrive to the staff working all day to keep the rooms clean and commmunal ares spotless. Yes, my friends and I saw prostitutes right outside, however the receptionist "jordi" told us exactly where to go to avoid any trouble, and I can honestly say that as 3 girls we did not feel threatened once. The police presence is huge to avoid any trouble. The hotel Barbara is an excellent location to explore Barcelona, especially the nightlife as everything is so close. I would go to the same hotel with no hesitation, and would recommend to friends. The prostitutes we are told are being moved outside the city in two weeks, and I think this will make Hotel Barbara a popular destination.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny and we had a few different three bed and two bed rooms on a hen weekend, with very limited wardrobe space and only one mirror in bathroom. It was a nightmare all of us getting ready to go out. The neighbourhood is intimidating even when you're in a group of 15. We were hissed at and followed down the road to the hotel and even the taxi drivers were warning us to be careful. Taxi drivers lock their doors on the way into this neighbourhood. It is cheap and near the Rambles but for peace of mind and more space stay elsewhere. Be aware of pickpockets as two of our party had their bags stolen in the centre of Barcelona and we were being careful. Probably better suited to a stag party!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Barbara
HotelInfo.Address: Marques de Barbara 22, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
